page.title: 01UPPER BEXHILL AND SIDLEY
page.content: This undulating area lies just in- land from the{Sussex coast}and can be cut diagonally in half from N.W. to S.E. following the A269/A2036. South of the line the block is mainly residential, comprising the outskirts of the{resort}and{retirement town of{Bexhill.}North of this the block is mainly farm and woodland. {Sidley,}once a village but now a suburb of Bexhill, has it's own shopping centre and lies in the middle of the block. The main road south into the resort from Sidley passes to it's east{Bexhill Old Town,}which has an ancient church and weather-boarded houses. The A259 coast road from Eastbourne to Hastings follows the southern boundary of the area. A new by-pass avoids the Old Town, the modern centre now lying south towards the seafront.
